overview:
## Return Value

An `OSStatus` result code.

## Discussion

Drivers may call this function to dispose of device objects that they haven’t already added to the system using [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDISetupAddDevice(_:)]. To remove a device after adding it to the session, call [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDISetupRemoveDevice(_:)].

Nondrivers can’t call this function, and instead must call [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDISetupAddDevice(_:)] and [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDISetupRemoveDevice(_:)].

# MIDIDeviceDispose(_:)

**Function**

Disposes of a MIDI device.

## Declaration

```swift
func MIDIDeviceDispose(_ device: MIDIDeviceRef) -> OSStatus
```

## Parameters

- **device**: The device to dispose.

## Return Value

An `OSStatus` result code.

## Discussion

Drivers may call this function to dispose of device objects that they haven’t already added to the system using [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDISetupAddDevice(_:)]. To remove a device after adding it to the session, call [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDISetupRemoveDevice(_:)].

Nondrivers can’t call this function, and instead must call [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDISetupAddDevice(_:)] and [doc://com.apple.coremidi/documentation/CoreMIDI/MIDISetupRemoveDevice(_:)].

## Managing Device Lifecyle

- **MIDIDeviceCreate(_:_:_:_:_:)**: Creates a new device object that corresponds to the available hardware.
- **MIDIDeviceRef**: A MIDI device that contains entities.
